revised_title: Three-dimensional Reconstruction of Stacked-Disk Aggregate of Tobacco Mosaic Virus Protein
tldr: Researchers used electron microscopy to study the structure of the stacked-disk aggregate of tobacco mosaic virus protein. They discovered a new polymorphic form of the protein, a double helical structure, and reconstructed the three-dimensional structure of the stacked-disk rod to a resolution of about 2 nm. The findings provide insights into the relationship between the rings comprising a disk and the structure's polar aggregation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Structural Biology
